results.title: Acts of God
results.brief_description: Takes an entertaining and informative look at freak weather conditions - commonly referred to as “Acts of God” - and at how the human body stands up to their violent effects. Shows the design of windproof structures and their effects on people and looks at designing to meet these problems.

results.title: Activity sampling: a training film
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures and David Stevens
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the technique by simulating a real-life office situation. It aims at giving students practice in distinguishing between the various activities observed and calculating results from their observations.

results.title: Activity group therapy: as developed at the Jewish Board of Guardians
results.brief_description: Shows the treatment of children’s personality disorders through their participation in group activities guided by a permissive adult. Focuses on three boys with different problems: one is over-aggressive, another is withdrawn and latently schizophrenic and the third is introverted and suffering from anxiety hysteria. Their progress is traced through many scenes of group activities, filmed with a hidden camera.

results.title: Action stations
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Kip Porteous and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: Experimental film which brings alive a small boy’s dream as he wanders to the Sydney Harbour waterfront and imagines life on a “mothball” warship. Without commentary, but with clever use of sound the warship resounds to the cry of “Action Stations”, the sound of running feet, firing, vibrations and cheers echo through the empty ship. Finally the ship’s flag is run up and the dream ends with his mother calling him home.

results.title: Action loop
results.creator_credit: Filmpartnership, Melbourne Underground Rail Loop Authority and Dudley Robinson
results.brief_description: Shows the progress being made in the construction of the underground rail loop in the city of Melbourne. The four tunnels will link five stations at Flinders Street, Parliament, the Museum, Flagstaff and Spencer Street, thus relieving the present strain on the city’s transport system. Although much work is yet to be completed - overhead wiring, retaining walls, rails to be laid - by the early 1980’s, Melbourne will be a modern transport system city. Narrated by Michael Pate. Photographed by Dudley Robinson.

results.title: Action in Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Department of the Army, Frank Bagnal and John Abbott
results.brief_description: Scenes of the Australian Army First Battalion in South Vietnam. Shows part of a search and destroy mission in War Zone D. Also shows Vietnam under attack and the setting up of a medical post in a village. Narrated by Max Meldrum.

results.title: Action for children's television: kids for sale
results.creator_credit: Cinema Graphics, Jim Herzig and Yale Marc
results.brief_description: Provides an analysis of some of the critical issues concerning children and television. Examines the role of broadcasters and advertisers, with particular reference to the types of programs selected for transmission and the nature of the commercials shown. Finally, viewers are challenged to take an active role in improving children’s television. Suitable for upper secondary, tertiary and teacher levesl.

results.title: Action-reaction
results.brief_description: A study of the changing approach to the teaching of physical education in Victorian secondary schools. Shows how the highly competitive and restrictive activities of cricket and football have been augmented by a wide range of both popular and unusual sports which allow the student to develop within his own capacity.

results.title: Acting problems
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Wesley Greene, Robert Edmonds and Betty Edmonds
results.brief_description: Dr Maurice Griesen directs four actors from the Goodman Memorial Theatre in scenes from “Tom Sawyer”. He discusses the actor’s problem of achieving characterization and theatrical terms such as improvisation and rhythm tempo.
